dashboard.description:
# Virtualization Project The Virtualization Project pack will help you during your migration process, from planning to post-migration checks. # Overview See your landscape and monitor the status of your Virtualization migration project.
**Total number of users** * Here you can see the number of users that are in scope for the project (i.e. both migrated and not yet migrated devices). * You can see how many users are on pilots' devices. * Also the number of users still to migrate in case of full VDI. * Below that you can find the mobility profiles of users.
**Total number of Applications** * Here you can see the number of applications that are in scope for the project (i.e. both migrated and not yet migrated devices). * You can see how many applications are one device only. * You can see how many applications have internet traffic (if the Proxy category is configured).
**Total number of devices** * Here you can see the number of devices that are in scope for the project (i.e. both migrated and not yet migrated devices). * You can see how many devices are without active users. * You can focus on how many devices has more than two screens. * Also the number of devices still to migrate.
**Attached Devices** * Here you can see the local printer ::: tip Physical >2 screens: devices with more than two screens could have those problems: * Need GPU on the Virtual infrastructure or more CPU. * Need specific hardware for the client part (Thin-client or another client) ::: ::: configuration * In order to take full advantage of this content pack, categories, scores, and metrics need to be adjusted. * Proxy category is configured :::
dashboard.name: Overview

metric.label: With internet traffic on physical devices
With <1 domain user on Physical devices

dashboard.description:
# Application experience This dashboard presents the experience of your users when using applications from their Pilots groups.
# Overview * You can compare two types of virtual devices with this dashboard * You can compare the application crash and freeze ratios and pinpoint the applications causing the most issues.
# Details
Take look at applications with high CPU, freezes, and crashes.
::: tip * The **application crash ratio** and **application not responding event ratio** respectively indicate the number of application crashes and the number of application freezes per 100 executions. * Define a strategy to randomize all infrastructure maintenance tasks like antivirus, reporting or other tasks scheduled locally or on the infrastructure part. ::: ::: configuration * In order to take full advantage of this content pack, categories, scores, and metrics need to be adjusted. :::
dashboard.name: Pilot1 vs Pilot2 : Application experience

tableConfig.title: Applications generating high thread CPU usage on Pilots 1 devices

metric.label: Top applications with highest application thread CPU time ratio on Pilot1

tableConfig.title: Applications freezing most on Pilots 1 devices
Applications crashing most on Pilots 1 devices
Applications generating high thread CPU usage on Pilot 2 devices

metric.label: Virtualization - Project - Top applications with highest application thread CPU time ratio on Pilot2

tableConfig.title: Applications freezing most on Pilot 2 devices
Applications crashing most on Pilot 2 devices

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization: Project
These dashboards target the current state of Pilot groups.
# Analyze Device Performance - Pilot groups
**Identify Overloaded VDI Desktops** * Devices that are overworked may be impacting user Productivity. Use this dashboard to see both the number of vdi that are experiencing issues and also the top offenders listed so they can be directly addressed.
**Understand Network Issues on VDI Desktops** * Network issues for VDI desktops may cause desktop freezing, glitching or straightforward application pausing and should be addressed. By combining this with a view on how much traffic is going to the VDI infrastructure is talking to may reveal unexpected traffic volumes which could be a contributing factor.
**Understanding VDI Availability** * Bluescreen crashes or Hard Resets are a clear indicator of unexpected behavior. If this figure shows signs of having any significant amount of devices, it should be looked into. ::: tip To get a live view, take look in the Finder in Virtualization services. ::: ::: configuration * Please populate pilot categories. * [Configuration guide](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/VirtualizationPlanningandMigration) :::
dashboard.name: Pilot1 vs Pilot2 : Performance

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization: Project
The dashboards target the current state of Pilot groups.
# Analyze Device Performance of two pilots
**Identify Overloaded VDI Desktops** * Devices that are overworked may be impacting user Productivity. Use this dashboard to see both the number of vdi that are experiencing issues and also the top offenders listed so they can be directly addressed.
**Understand Network Issues on VDI Desktops** * Network issues for VDI desktops may cause desktop freezing, glitching or straightforward application pausing and should be addressed. By combining this with a view on how much traffic is going to the VDI infrastructure is talking to may reveal unexpected traffic volumes which could be a contributing factor.
**Understanding VDI Availability** * Bluescreen crashes or Hard Resets are a clear indicator of unexpected behavior. If this figure shows signs of having any significant amount of devices, it should be looked into.
::: tip To get a live view, take look in the Finder in Virtualization services. :::
::: configuration * Please populate pilot categories. * [Configuration guide](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/VirtualizationPlanningandMigration) :::
dashboard.name: Pilot1 vs Pilot2 : Pilot Trend

dashboard.description:
# Application experience This dashboard presents the experience of your users when using applications from their physical and virtual devices.
# Overview
* You can compare the application crash and freeze ratios and pinpoint the applications causing the most issues. * You can predict witch application need more resources and can impact the user experience.
# Details
Take look at applications with high CPU, freezes, and crashes.
::: tip * The **application crash ratio** and **application not responding event ratio** respectively indicate the number of application crashes and the number of application freezes per 100 executions. * Define a strategy to randomize all infrastructure maintenance tasks like antivirus, reporting or other tasks scheduled locally or on the infrastructure part. :::
dashboard.name: Pilots vs Physical : Application experience

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization: Project
These dashboards target the current state of Production vs Pilots.
# Analyze Device Performance - Pilots vs Physical
**Identify Overloaded VDI Desktops** * Digital Experience Score The Digital Experience Score measures the digital employee experience, defined as the ability of an employee to get things done by interacting with the IT environment in a safe and enjoyable manner.
* Devices that are overworked may be impacting user Productivity. Use this dashboard to see both the number of desktops that are experiencing issues and also the top offenders listed so they can be directly addressed.
**Understand Network Issues on VDI Desktops** * Network issues for VDI desktops may cause desktop freezing, glitching or straightforward application pausing and should be addressed. By combining this with a view on how much traffic is going to the VDI infrastructure is talking to may reveal unexpected traffic volumes which could be a contributing factor.
**Understanding VDI Availability** * Bluescreen crashes or Hard Resets are a clear indicator of unexpected behavior. If this figure shows signs of having any significant amount of devices, it should be looked into. ::: tip To get a live view, take look in the Finder in Virtualization services. ::: ::: configuration * Please populate pilot categories. * [Configuration guide](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/LibraryPacksConfiguration/VirtualizationPlanningandMigration) :::
dashboard.name: Pilots vs Physical : Performance

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization: Project
The dashboards target the current state of Production vs Pilots.
# Analyze Device Performance - Virtual vs Physical
**Identify Overloaded VDI Desktops** * Devices that are overworked may be impacting user Productivity. Use this dashboard to see both the number of desktops that are experiencing issues and also the top offenders listed so they can be directly addressed.
**Understand Network Issues on VDI Desktops** * Network issues for VDI desktops may cause desktop freezing, glitching or straightforward application pausing and should be addressed. By combining this with a view on how much traffic is going to the VDI infrastructure is talking to may reveal unexpected traffic volumes which could be a contributing factor.
**Understanding VDI Availability** * Bluescreen crashes or Hard Resets are a clear indicator of unexpected behavior. If this figure shows signs of having any significant amount of devices, it should be looked into.
::: tip To get a live view, take look in the Finder in Virtualization services. :::
dashboard.name: Pilots vs Physical : Pilot Trend

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization: Project
# Virtual vs Production: Satisfaction
**Pre-deployment & Post-deployment satisfaction on Virtualization** * Survey your Production employees before the deployment to define a baseline satisfaction of the current user experience on physical devices. Run the same survey after the pilot is ongoing.
**Satisfaction breakdown** * See the distribution of the satisfaction.
**What users like the most** * Compare the positive points before and after the deployment of the Virtualization.
**What users dislike the most** * Compare the negative points before and after the deployment of the Virtualization. ::: tip You can use survey to inform your users about the migration deployment (before the change to save documents) or to improve their knowledge. :::
dashboard.name: Pilots vs Prod : Comparing Feedback

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization Project The Virtualization Project pack will help you during your migration process, from planning to post-migration checks.
# Understand the current landscape See your landscape to detect how devices or applications profiles and issues.
* Digital Experience Score The Digital Experience Score measures the digital employee experience, defined as the ability of an employee to get things done by interacting with the IT environment in a safe and enjoyable manner.
* Devices that are overworked may be impacting user Productivity. Use this dashboard to see both the number of desktops that are experiencing issues and also the top offenders listed so they can be directly addressed. ::: tip Disk system usage: Take a look at this information to check if your users are using the local system drive to store documents or to predict the impact on the target storage. You can investigate the details with a click on "Investigate on the finder" :::
::: configuration * In order to take full advantage of this content pack, categories, scores, and metrics need to be adjusted. :::
dashboard.name: Understand Current Landscape

titleConfig.title: Number of Devices by Disk Space usage in percentage

dashboard.description:
# Virtualization Project The Virtualization Project pack will help you during your migration process, from planning to post-migration checks.
# Understand User Persona's Here you can take an overview of mobility and resource usage.
**Mobility** Mobility is based on the score "Virtualization User Mobility". This score is calculated from device type (Laptop, Desktop), the number of devices per user and other metrics.
**Ressource usage** Here you can see information about the profile of the usage of the device. ::: tip Define your strategy for the deployment of your users. In the case of VDI, if users with a physical device are going on a thin client without a VDI attribution, he could be blocked. ::: ::: configuration * In order to take full advantage of this content pack, categories, scores, and metrics need to be adjusted. * Installation of Persona's is required :::
dashboard.name: Understand User Persona's
